fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Hello, and welcome to my personal website.
I am a research mathematician interested in applied topology, category theory, homological algebra, type theory and formal verification.

At the moment, I primarily work on applied topology, in the CÃ¡mara Lab at the University of Pennsylvania. Specifically, I apply the Gromov-Wasserstein distance to the study of cell morphology. I also maintain CAJAL, a Python package for the analysis of cell morphology.

This website is under construction. Over the course of the next few weeks, I intend to start blogging here and uploading content, ideally, both my about my mathematics research, and potentially some literate formal verification using the Rocq theorem prover.

Some things you might find interesting:
Category theory
Some nice looking Rocq proofs: try here, here, and here.
I am a category theorist, so it will be nice to start with some discussion of category theory.
The first thing we will do is try to semi-organically weave some Coq code into all this using Alectryon.
